body_content.explanation: to separate people or things for a second, third, etc. time into different levels of quality, size, importance, etc.:
examples: Some of the farmers are now hiring private contractors to regrade the crop.
Because of the extra responsibilities, the job was re-graded so that she received a significant increase in pay.

body_content.explanation: to give a score to a student's piece of work for a second, third, etc. time:
examples: State education officials will probably re-grade the math tests.
Go away and redo the assignment, then come back and I might regrade it.
